comment.body:
`https://animesdigital.org/video/a/116110/` after clicking on player it goes to `sabornutritivo.com` which needs

```adb
sabornutritivo.com#%#//scriptlet('no-setTimeout-if', 'hasAdblock')
```

Also for the link in the issue description:

```adb
ricasdelicias.online#%#//scriptlet('no-setTimeout-if', 'hasAdblock')
ricasdelicias.online#$##player { display: block !important; }
```

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Content Blocker, AdGuard for Android, AdGuard for iOS ### AdGuard version 4.5.3 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? Chrome, Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.uber.com/en-AT/blog/how-ledgerstore-supports-trillions-of-indexes ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, EasyList ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets AdGuard Social Media filter ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. The `AdGuard Social Widgets` filter is breaking the content on the Uber Engineering Blog. This is breaking both on Mobile(Android and iOS Safari) and on Chrome with uBlock Origin 2. Screenshots

issue.title: x.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fx.com%2FPETEandrepete_%2Fstatus%2F1788379241815445981) ### Comment > I use the app Downie https://software.charliemonroe.net/downie/ to download audio, video, and images from various websites. One such was of starting a download is to paste the URL of a page that contains the item you want to download. > > This works 100% of the time for everything EXCEPT Twitter. Excuse me, X.com. > > So say I want to download this gif of a tornado that I just tweeted. The URL is https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 and pasting this directly into Downie will cause an error "Error: Cannot find configuration URL. > > If the URL is simply changed to https://twitter.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 then it downloads perfectly. > > This ONLY happens when AdGuard is running. Disable it and you can now use either x.com or twitter.com URLs. > > A while back I THOUGHT i had nailed this down as being related to DNS Protection, which i had been using at the time. Seems like when I changed it or disabled it the problem went away, however that is not the case as of now. So the only workaround is to change the URL manually. AdGuard Content Blocker, AdGuard for Android, AdGuard for iOS ### AdGuard version 4.5.3 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? Chrome, Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.uber.com/en-AT/blog/how-ledgerstore-supports-trillions-of-indexes ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, EasyList ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets AdGuard Social Media filter ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. The `AdGuard Social Widgets` filter is breaking the content on the Uber Engineering Blog. This is breaking both on Mobile(Android and iOS Safari) and on Chrome with uBlock Origin 2. Screenshots
